# headerAndFooter

**Type Property**

An `NSNumber` object containing a Boolean value that specifies whether to include a header and footer.

## Declaration

```swift
static let headerAndFooter: NSPrintInfo.AttributeKey
```

## Discussion

If [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/true], a standard header and footer are added outside the margins of each page.

## Other Attributes

- **allPages**: An `NSNumber` object containing a Boolean value that specifies whether to include all pages.
- **copies**: An `NSNumber` object containing an integer—the number of copies to spool.
- **detailedErrorReporting**: An `NSNumber` object containing a Boolean value that specifies whether to produce detailed error reports.
- **faxNumber**: An `NSString` object that specifies a fax number.
- **firstPage**: An `NSNumber` object containing an integer value that specifies the first page in the print job.
- **jobDisposition**: An `NSString` object that specifies the job disposition.
- **jobSavingFileNameExtensionHidden**: An `NSNumber` object containing a Boolean value that specifies whether to hide the job’s file name extension.
- **jobSavingURL**: An `NSURL` containing the location to which the job file will be saved when the [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSPrintInfo/jobDisposition-swift.property] is [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSPrintInfo/JobDisposition-swift.struct/save].
- **lastPage**: An `NSNumber` object containing an integer value that specifies the last page in the print job.
- **mustCollate**: An `NSNumber` object containing a Boolean value that specifies whether to collate output.
- **pagesAcross**: An `NSNumber` object that specifies the number of logical pages to be tiled horizontally on a physical sheet of paper.
- **pagesDown**: An `NSNumber` object that specifies the number of logical pages to be tiled vertically on a physical sheet of paper.
- **printer**: An `NSPrinter` object—the printer to use.
- **printerName**: An `NSString` object that specifies the name of a printer.
- **reversePageOrder**: An `NSNumber` object containing a Boolean value that specifies whether to print pages in reverse order.
